module.name: functional_data_and_schematic_representation
module.keywords: module, individual ,class, product, activity, document, organization, person, structure, property, identification, description, intelligent, schematic, representation, process plant

purpose.P: The Functional data and schematic representation application module supports the requirement to record:

UL.LI: schematic representation, which is a diagram that presents the classification, structure, properties and identification of products, activities, documents, organisations and people by the relative position of symbols.

purpose.P: A schematic representation may be 'intelligent', which means that the symbols are associated with the things they represent.

LI.P: the classification, structure, properties and identification of products, activities, documents, organisations and people;

note.P: This is within the scope of the Functional_data application module.
This is within the scope of the Schematic_and_symbolization application module.

LI.P: associations between symbols on a schematic diagram and the things that the symbols represent.

note.P: This is within the scope of the Schematic_and_symbolization application module.

Application software can use the associations to make the schematic diagram 'intelligent'. This means that a user of the software can select a symbol on the diagram, and thereby obtain further information about the object that is represented.
